newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Ten Network argues for cross-media status quo.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Ten Network argues for cross-media status quo.

text.p: Network Ten Ltd, Australia's third-ranked television network which counts Canada's Izzy Asper as a key shareholder, said in a submission to the government there should be no change in current regulations which restrict ownership of both free-to-air broadcasting and newspapers.

However, the company said in its submission to the government's media inquiry that total foreign investment via "voting stock" in a commercial television licence should be increased to 35 percent from 20 percent. Asper's CanWest Global Communications Corp has a 15 percent voting stake and a 57.5 percent economic stake in Ten.

The Australian Broadcasting Authority has ruled that CanWest does not control Ten by virtue of its economic interest. It already has the maximum permissible voting stake for any individual foreign shareholders.

Ten argued that if the Government did lessen the cross-media regulations, which prohibit control of a newspaper and television licence in the same area, then foreign ownership limits on voting stock should be significantly increased.
It said it supported the newspaper-television restrictions as this prevented concentration of media ownership.
